results.title: Airplanes: how they fly
results.creator_credit: Hal Kopel and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Two children learn from a model airplane enthusiast how an airplane’s wings keep it in the air and how the propeller makes it move forward. The children go for an airplane ride and the pilot demonstrates the controls and explains how they work.

results.title: An Airman remembers: recollections by Sir Gordon Taylor
results.creator_credit: Cecil Holmes, K Porteous and ABC
results.brief_description: The history of aviation in Australia, recounting the achievements of such men as Kingsford- Smith, Hargrave, Hart, Ross Smith, Taylor, and indicating the trails they blazed.

results.title: Air power is peace power
results.brief_description: Short documentary featuring WWI American ace air pilot, Capt. Eddie Rickenbacker (President of Eastern Air Lines), representing the airline’s push for more air power in the United States in the form of the Constellation airplane.

results.title: Air pollution
results.creator_credit: Gilbert Altschul Productions and Journal Films
results.brief_description: Defines air pollution and views the many man-made and natural causes. Uses plant life to show how pollution affects health and the economy. Discusses elimination of the sources of pollution and possible methods of control. Covers facts and broad social trends relating to the problem.

results.title: Air crossroads - London
results.creator_credit: John Arnold, Basic Films and Film Workshop, Central Office of Information
results.brief_description: London is the busiest airport in the world; 38 airlines use it and some 600 planes arrive and depart every 24 hours. Passengers from many nations pass through the airport and are assisted in every way posible by an efficient staff. The control tower and servicing staff are in operation seven days of the week, 24 hours a day. When passenger planes are not so numerous heavy freight planes take over. Radio control enables planes to land and take off in foggy weather and at night.

results.title: Air crew
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Thompson and Australia. Royal Air Force. Films Advisory Bureau
results.brief_description: The training of pilots and navigators for careers in the Royal Australian Air Force is described in detail. Young men with strong mathematical aptitudes excel in these fields, especially navigation. Training is carried out in a number of RAAF schools in different parts of the Commonwealth. The film closes with an account of life on the Australian base at Butterworth in Malaya.

results.title: Agronomy
results.creator_credit: Jean Palardy, Raymond Garceau and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Describes the introduction of co-operative dairy farming in the eastern townships of Quebec to increase agricultural output and improve marketing methods. Recalls some of the difficulties encountered in the early days of the Agricultural Co-operative of Granby and cites the success of the Granby Co-operative as an example of what can be achieved when agricultural expert and farmer work in close co-operation.
